text: Assink in a directed graph is a vertex i such that there is an edge from every vertex j # 4 to % and there is no edge from i to any other vertex. A directed graph G with n vertices is represented by its adjacency matrix A, where A[i][j] = 1if there is an edge directed from vertex i to j and 0 otherwise.
